Administration.name: Administration
Administration.definition: The ability to organize people, resources, and time to help the church reach its goals and be effective.

Apostleship.name: Apostleship
Apostleship.definition: The ability to start new ministries and oversee their development, often in new places or cultures.

Discernment.name: Discernment
Discernment.definition: The ability to distinguish between truth and error, and to sense the presence of good or evil spirits.

Encouragement.name: Encouragement
Encouragement.definition: The ability to encourage, comfort, and challenge others to grow in their faith and overcome struggles.

Evangelism.name: Evangelism
Evangelism.definition: The ability to communicate the gospel effectively so that unbelievers become disciples of Jesus.

Faith.name: Faith
Faith.definition: The ability to trust God for what cannot be seen and to act on God's promises with confidence.

Giving.name: Giving
Giving.definition: The ability to contribute material resources to the work of the Lord with liberality and cheerfulness.

Healing.name: Healing
Healing.definition: The ability to be used by God to restore health to the sick through prayer and reliance on the Holy Spirit.

Helps.name: Helps
Helps.definition: The ability to invest the talents one has in the life and ministry of other members of the body, thus enabling those others to increase the effectiveness of their own spiritual gifts.

Hospitality.name: Hospitality
Hospitality.definition: The ability to welcome and care for guests and strangers with a warm and generous spirit.

Intercession.name: Intercession
Intercession.definition: The ability to pray faithfully for others and identify specific answerable prayer needs.

Knowledge.name: Knowledge
Knowledge.definition: The ability to discover, accumulate, analyze, and clarify information and ideas that are pertinent to the growth and well-being of the body.

Leadership.name: Leadership
Leadership.definition: The ability to set goals in accordance with God's purpose for the future and to communicate these goals to others in such a way that they voluntarily and harmoniously work together to accomplish those goals.

Mercy.name: Mercy
Mercy.definition: The ability to feel genuine empathy and compassion for individuals who suffer distressing physical, mental, or emotional problems and to translate that compassion into cheerfully done deeds that reflect Christ's love and alleviate the suffering.

Miracles.name: Miracles
Miracles.definition: The ability to serve as a human intermediary through whom it pleases God to perform powerful acts that are perceived by observers to have altered the ordinary course of nature.

Prophecy.name: Prophecy
Prophecy.definition: The ability to proclaim and apply God's truth in a relevant manner for understanding, correction, or edification.

Service.name: Service
Service.definition: The ability to identify unmet needs involved in a task related to God's work, and to make use of available resources to meet those needs and help accomplish the desired results.

Shepherd.name: Shepherd
Shepherd.definition: The ability to assume a long-term personal responsibility for the spiritual welfare of a group of believers.

Teaching.name: Teaching
Teaching.definition: The ability to communicate information relevant to the health and ministry of the body and its members in such a way that others will learn.

Tongues.name: Tongues
Tongues.definition: The ability to receive and communicate an immediate message of God to His people through a divinely anointed utterance in a language never learned.

Wisdom.name: Wisdom
Wisdom.definition: The ability to apply spiritual truth effectively to meet a need in a specific situation.
